meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force.
meanings.sent1: He clobbers the ball with his bat during the game.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler clobbers his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The giant robot clobbers the city buildings in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The storm clobbers the coast with strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The hammer clobbers the nail into the wood effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: She packed her favorite clobbers for the trip.
meanings.sent2: His clobbers were neatly hung in the wardrobe.
meanings.sent3: The lost suitcase contained all his clobbers for the party.
meanings.sent4: The fashion store displayed trendy clobbers in the window.
meanings.sent5: The laundry basket was full of colorful clobbers waiting to be washed.

meanings.definition: To defeat decisively in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The champion clobbers his opponent in the final round.
meanings.sent2: The team clobbers their rivals with a flawless performance.
meanings.sent3: The underdog unexpectedly clobbers the top-seeded player.
meanings.sent4: The quiz show contestant clobbers the competition with quick answers.
meanings.sent5: The chess grandmaster clobbers his opponent in just a few moves.
